name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

key_work.title: Wilhelm scream
key_work.brief_description: Exhibition video created by ACMI for the Fed Square Foyer display; forefronting the use of the ‘Wilhelm Scream’ in film and TV

end.title: Star Wars
end.creator_credit: George Lucas, Gary Kurtz, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
end.brief_description: A Long time ago in a galaxy far far away, George Lucas’s space adventure captured the hearts and imaginations of film lovers of all ages from the moment these words scrolled across the screen. The Empire’s evil Death Star must be destroyed. The heroes, Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, Han Solo and a pair of droids named R2-D2 and C-3PO, as part of the Rebel Alliance, must pit their strength against the might of the Empire and the evil Jedi, Darth Vader. With the help of an old Jedi Knight, Obi-Wan Kenobi, they battle the forces of darkness and triumph. The special effects and famous “Star wars” theme music has ensured that this film takes its place in cinema history. Includes a ten minute interview between George Lucas and Leonard Maltin.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

constellations_other.name: Eighties hunks
constellations_other.description: Thor’s hero costume from Thor: Love and Thunder was inspired by classic comics of the 80s. Gone are the military greys, replaced with bright golds and bold colours. Let’s take a look at the lineage of 80s action heroes to which this version of Thor belongs.

links.description: The Wilhelm scream is a famous shriek first used in Distant Dreams, and later over 400 films, including the Star Wars franchise. Ben Burtt, the sound designer, is credited with turning the stock sound into an in-joke between sound designers.

start.creator_credit: George Lucas, Gary Kurtz, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

end.title: Ready Player One
end.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Kasia Walicka Maimone, Dan Farah, Donald De Line, Kristie Macosko Krieger, Amblin Entertainment, De Line Pictures, Dune Entertainment, Farah Films & Management, Reliance Entertainment, Village Roadshow Pictures, Warner Bros. Pictures, Adam Stockhausen, Ernest Cline and Zak Penn

video_links.name: READY PLAYER ONE - Come With Me

end.brief_description: When the creator of a popular video game system dies, a virtual contest is created to compete for his fortune.

constellations_other.name: Future forward; cyberpunk manifestations, fantasy and world building
constellations_other.description: Science fiction and cyberpunk are often powerful projections of the future, which may act as dystopic warnings or strive for an optimistic outcome where societies rise above adversity.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

links.description: The Wilhelm scream is basically an easter egg, a message or in-joke in a piece of media that’s difficult to identify. Easter eggs are a key narrative feature of Ready Player One, which contains a reference to Star Wars.

start.title: Adventure
start.brief_description: Adventure is a video game for the Atari 2600 video game console, released at Christmas time in 1979. In the game, the player controls a square avatar whose quest is to hunt an open world environment for a magical chalice, returning it to the golden castle.

constellations_other.name: Easter Eggs on screen
constellations_other.description: People have been slipping secrets into films, games and television for as long as they have existed.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

end.title: The Legend of Zelda
end.brief_description: Set in the fantasy land of Hyrule, the plot centers on a boy named Link, the playable protagonist, who aims to collect the eight fragments of the Triforce of Wisdom in order to rescue Princess Zelda from the antagonist, Ganon.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

constellations_other.name: Significant sounds
constellations_other.description: The arrival of synchronised sound dramatically changed the movie business, allowing filmmakers to use sound in new and exciting ways which developed the use sound into own film language.

links.description: As well as featuring the first Easter egg, Adventure is also recognised as a predecessor of the open-world genre. It inspired a gameplay style adapted by major franchises to follow like The Legend of Zelda.

start.title: The Legend of Zelda
start.brief_description: Set in the fantasy land of Hyrule, the plot centers on a boy named Link, the playable protagonist, who aims to collect the eight fragments of the Triforce of Wisdom in order to rescue Princess Zelda from the antagonist, Ganon.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

constellations_other.name: Significant sounds
constellations_other.description: The arrival of synchronised sound dramatically changed the movie business, allowing filmmakers to use sound in new and exciting ways which developed the use sound into own film language.

end.title: Metroid
end.brief_description: It’s you against the evil Mother Brain in the thrilling battle of Metroid! You’re inside the fortress planet Zebes. The planet of endless secret passageways where the Metroid are multiplying. Left alone the Metroid are harmless. But in the wrong hands they could destroy the galaxy. It’s up to you to prevent the Mother Brain that controls Zebes from using the Metroid for evil purposes. But that won’t be easy. You’ll have to use your spacesuit to absorb valuable energy for your search to gain the use of power items like the Ice Beam, Wave Beam, High Jump Boots and Varia. If you survive, it will be you and your acquired powers against the Mother Brain.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

links.description: The same year, Nintendo released Metroid, another open world title that featured one of the first female protagonists in videogames. It later inspire a sub-genre of open world games called “Metroidvania”, which combined its non-linear format with Castlevania.

constellations_other.description: People have been slipping secrets into films, games and television for as long as they have existed.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

links.description: A major plot point of Ready Player One involves locating a secret room in the 1979 Atari game Adventure, which is widely regarded as the first videogame with an Easter egg, created by Warren Robinett after being denied a programmer credit.
